title: Sam Bates
text:
Sam Bates (born 2 December 1995) is an English <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played as a prop for the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> and <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury Rams</a>.
Bradford.
2014.
Bates was named in the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a>' team for the first time on 21 April 2014, for the match against <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a>. He made his professional début in this match, when he came on as a replacement for <a href="Jamal%20Fakir">Jamal Fakir</a> after 18 minutes, but was unable to prevent the Bradford Bulls from succumbing to an 84-6 defeat. He appeared again in the following match against <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a>. In June 2014, he signed a new two-year contract with Bradford Bulls.
2015.
Bates did not feature in any of the pre-season friendlies.
Near the start of the season Bates was released from the club.
Statistics.
Statistics do not include pre-season friendlies.
